title.native: デジモンゴーストゲーム

description:
Sightings of mysterious creatures known as "Hologram Ghosts" have been a popular topic on social networks for the past few years. According to the rumors, several people have fallen victim to these specters. Those fortunate to survive their encounters with the paranormal beings claim that they resembled glitched holograms.

Hazakura Academy middle school student Hiro Amanokawa believes these sightings are merely an urban legend. However, as the incidents start to increase in frequency, he is reminded of the day his father suddenly vanished, with strange digital watches serving as the only relics of his disappearance. Much like the other sightings, what happened to Hiro's father cannot be explained by conventional logic.

One day, when a fellow student in the academy is attacked by a Hologram Ghost, Hiro and his friend Kiyoshirou Higashimitarai decide to look into the matter. Little does Hiro know that this investigation will be their first step toward discovering a dangerous world previously unknown to mankind.

(Source: MAL Rewrite)

tags.name: Kids
tags.description: Target demographic is young children.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Body Horror
tags.description: Features characters who undergo horrific transformations or disfigurement, often to their own detriment.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Youkai
tags.description: Prominently features supernatural creatures from Japanese folklore.

tags.name: Henshin
tags.description: Prominently features character or costume transformations which often grant special abilities.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Primarily Child Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters below a high school age.

tags.name: Ghost
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a ghost.

tags.name: Dinosaurs
tags.description: Prominently features Dinosaurs, prehistoric reptiles that went extinct millions of years ago.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Kaiju
tags.description: Prominently features giant monsters.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Zombie
tags.description: Prominently features reanimated corpses which often prey on live humans and turn them into zombies.

tags.name: Anthropomorphism
tags.description: Contains non-human character(s) that have attributes or characteristics of a human being.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Slavery
tags.description: Prominently features slaves, slavery, or slave trade.

tags.name: Yandere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is obsessively in love with another, to the point of acting deranged or violent.

tags.name: Dullahan
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a Dullahan, a creature from Irish Folklore with a head that can be detached from its main body.

tags.name: Proxy Battle
tags.description: A proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode.

tags.name: Marriage
tags.description: Centers around marriage between two or more characters.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

title.native: デジモンアドベンチャー
モンスターディスコ
だって今日まで恋煩い

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mariko_itoh222) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/okome2014/)

In 2008, she married fellow animator [Tatsufumi Tamakawa](https://anilist.co/staff/109607/Tatsufumi-Itou), who changed his name to Tatsufumi Itou after marrying her. 

Her husband passed away from a brain hemorrhage on May 23, 2020.
Kenji Watanabe is the chief designer at WiZ Inc. Responsible for designing various monsters and characters from the "Digimon", "Tamagochi", "Magical Witches", and "Yoicocci" series.

He's credited on all relevant media as the creator of the original concept and character designs for the virtual pet franchise, Digimon. However, nothing is known about Hongo as an individual.

The name is actually a pseudonym for the three most important figures in the creation of the Digimon franchise: Aki Maita, one of the two creators of the original Tamagotchi; Hiroshi Izawa, the author of the first Digimon manga; and Takeichi Hongo, the director of marketing for Bandai.

(Source: Digimon Wikia)
Mitsuka is an animator, storyboarder, episode director, and director currently working at Toei Animation.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/cozy_ashfilm)__

__Residency:__ Tokyo, Japan

__Takeru Shinozuka__, alternatively known as Shino and ashcozy, is a Japanese director, scriptwriter, designer, photographer and animator. They run a personal video production label, known as AshFilm.

[Profile](https://www.imagine-music.co.jp/artist/index/9) | [Twitter](http://twitter.com/kowotani)

After graduating from university, he became a founding member of Yuji Saito's music production company IMAGINE in November 1986. The company has grown to feature musicians like Kohei Tanaka, Shiro Hamaguchi, Hayato Matsuo, and Shinji Miyazaki, who have become well known for cinematic scoring and orchestration through Otani. 

In 1987, he made his debut as an anime composer with the popular manga adaptation City Hunter, which earned him recognition in the industry. He later went on to work on titles such as Spy Games (1988), The Ultimate Teacher (1988), The Yadamura Waltz (1988), and You're Under Arrest (1994). The anime Future GPX Cyber Formula (1991) and Mobile Suit Gundam Wing (1995) and several films in the Gamera series are some of his most well-known works.  In 2001, he created the score to the film Godzilla, Mothra and King Ghidorah: Giant Monsters All-Out Attack. Other notable scores by Otani include Outlaw Star (1998), Gundam Wing: Endless Waltz (1998), Cross Fire (2000), The SoulTaker (2001), Haibane Renmei (2002), Zatch Bell! (2003), Eyeshield 21 (2005), Pumpkin Scissors (2006), Deltora Quest (2007), and Over Drive (2007). He has also been the music director and keyboardist of the band Dreams Come True. He appeared at Eminence Symphony Orchestra's events A Night in Fantasia 2007: Symphonic Games Edition and Unearthing Eden ~The sounds of AINARU~ in 2007.  

Throughout his career, Otani has also composed music for several video games, making his debut with the 1995 shooter game Philosoma. In 2000, he created the soundtrack to the flight simulator Sky Odyssey. He scored Shadow of the Colossus in 2005, his most famous video game work. Otani was responsible for composing the music for Wild Arms: Twilight Venom (2000), an anime adaptation of the Wild Arms video game series; he also arranged compositions of Michiko Naruke's music from the series. He did two more video game to anime adaptations: Night Warriors: Darkstalkers' Revenge (1997) and Popolocrois Monogatari (1998). In 2005, he created the track "Madness" alongside Hiroko Shigezumi for the Square Enix game Heavy Metal Thunder.

__[Website](https://aiiroapollo.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/aiiro_apollo) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/aiiro_apollo/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCHDYg2YiOQZRBtrVLPNKbzw)__

__Formed:__ 2020

__Biography:__
A 4-piece alternative rock band from Shimokitazawa.

__[Website](https://wienners.net/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/wienners_wns) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/wienners_official/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/c/Wienners_ch)__

__Formed:__ 2008

__Biography:__
Wienners is a Japanese Galaxy Punk Band formed in Kichijoji, Tokyo in 2008 by a guitarist/vocalist TAMAYA2060%.
The band consists of TAMAYA2060%, ASAMISAE(Vo/Key/Sampler), ∴560∵(Ba/Cho) and KOZO(Dr), and they have been developing their extremely unique electric punk rock for years. 
On May 13th, 2020, the first album in two years "BURST POP ISLAND" was released via Nippon Columbia, and they released a new digital single “GOD SAVE THE MUSIC” on August 27th, 2021.
Their distinctive music filled with unpredictable structures, billions of fantastic and catchy melodies, and friendly male and female twin vocals stimulates listeners' emotions no matter how old they are.
A Filipino animator affiliated with Toei Phils.
He is a professional screenwriter for anime, drama and theater and is a member of the Writers Guild of Japan.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamayama800) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/山口宏_(脚本家%29)

He's Japanese screenwriter and novelist, and one of the founders of Studio [Gonzo](https://anilist.co/studio/3/GONZO).
